page.title: 17New St Mary's Church, Walmer
page.content:
The foundation stone of the New St Mary's Church was laid on April 13th 1887 by the{Countess Granville. {Dr John Bird Benson,}Archbishop of Canterbury, consecrated the Church on April 5th 1888. It was buitl at an initial cost of Â£6,790.
The tower was also dedicated by {Archbishop Benson}in April 1893 and one of the eight bells is from the Old St Mary's.
The North Transept was converted into a{War Memorial Chapel}in 1923, with a tablet recording the names of the men who fell in the Great War from Upper Walmer.
A beech tree planted in one lawn commemorates the Silver Jubilee of King George V, 6th May 1935.
